data.event: Chester was officially founded in 1759 during the French and Indian War.
The first permanent European-descended settlers were a group from Massachusetts who came to the area in 1761.

During the American Revolution, the village avoided a raid by American Privateers wherein the townswomen, young and old, garbed in cloaks with their red lining worn outwards (to resemble the uniforms of the British soldiers) marched around the blockhouse (now the Wisteria Cottage House) in the early morning of 30 June 1782 to successfully convince American Privateers lying offshore to find another place to pillage.

event.title: The following day the privateers successfully executed

data.event: The following day the privateers successfully executed the Raid on Lunenburg, Nova Scotia (1782).

event.title: 1812, the American Privateer Young Teazer was trapped

data.event: During the War of 1812, the American Privateer Young Teazer was trapped off the shores of Chester by the HMS Hogue (1811).
